name: Black Alert
description: Moll intends to use her appearance in this time via temporal anomaly to seize what she wants most of all, even if that means tearing the universe apart at the mycelial level. Do you have what it takes to stop her?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of M. Burnham, Rhys, Owosekun, Discovery crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Hiawatha, the U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701, or the Breen Warship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: M. Burnham, Rhys, Owosekun, or Discovery

featured_crew.name: Hy'Rell
featured_crew.flavor: Archivist and guide for Booker and Burnham through the Eternal Archive and Gallery, a huge library with rare books and artifacts.

featured_crew.name: Rhys
featured_crew.flavor: Ready for any risks, Rhys volunteered to lead the operation to rescue the remaining colonists on the surface.

action.name: I'd Like To Volunteer To Lead The Evac Team

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Hy'Rell
rewards.flavor: Archivist and guide for Booker and Burnham through the Eternal Archive and Gallery, a huge library with rare books and artifacts.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Hy'Rell
rewards.flavor: Archivist and guide for Booker and Burnham through the Eternal Archive and Gallery, a huge library with rare books and artifacts.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "You all have not heard of me, but I promise you, you'll never forget my name after today. I know all about you all though. And I don't care. About any of you. Or your temporal anomaly crisis. I'm here for one thing. And it will be mine. Stay out of my way and you'll be fine."

"There's no way we can do that. Captain, I don't have much time to fill you in, but what Moll wants is nothing less than the power to alter fate itself. Despite what she says, she poses a major threat. We jumped to pursue her, but we're stuck in the mycelial network."

"And we aren't alone. Several other ships have surfaced here inside the mycelial network. We don't know how they got inside, but it's as if the network is fighting back against the unexpected invasion."

"It's literally eating away at our hull. If it keeps going, there'll be nothing left to protect us. We can't leave and risk losing Moll. We think we can make an opening like she did, but we need a little firepower to draw the intruders out."

"You all have not heard of me, but I promise you, you'll never forget my name after today. I know all about you all though. And I don't care. About any of you. Or your temporal anomaly crisis. I'm here for one thing. And it will be mine. Stay out of my way and you'll be fine."

"There's no way we can do that. Captain, I don't have much time to fill you in, but what Moll wants is nothing less than the power to alter fate itself. Despite what she says, she poses a major threat. We jumped to pursue her, but we're stuck in the mycelial network."

"And we aren't alone. Several other ships have surfaced here inside the mycelial network. We don't know how they got inside, but it's as if the network is fighting back against the unexpected invasion."

"It's literally eating away at our hull. If it keeps going, there'll be nothing left to protect us. We can't leave and risk losing Moll. We think we can make an opening like she did, but we need a little firepower to draw the intruders out."

"Unbelievable. The Federation says it wants to help everyone. Yet, it keeps something so useful as a secret method of travel to itself. Your little secret has been exposed, and these crews will ensure it becomes available to everyone."
"Damnit, she gave us the slip. And she's left even more obstacles in our path. More ships are trying to force their way back into the network. As a result, the network is fighting back even harder."

responses.text: "How did Moll even get in? How are these others getting in?"
"What exactly is the network doing to fight back?"
"Wait, can I have a spore drive?"

screens.text: "I hate to think about what this could mean for the fabric of space. The network's attack on these ships has destroyed a few and yet they keep trying to enter. Idiots!"

"I'm still not sure about Moll. We have our suspicions though. As for the others, Moll seems to have created a hole by way of an anomaly once she was in. Then, of course, there's the hole we created to get rid of the intruders! I think both will close - we just need time!"
"I don't know how strong your stomach is, Captain, so I'd rather not describe what we found on the remains of one ship. All I'll say is that it's like an immune system waging war on harmful cells."
"Is this really the time for that? Help us to secure the network and maybe,  maybe, we'll talk."
"Captain, we need you to fight off the ships trying to enter the network until the openings close!"

"Unbelievable. The Federation says it wants to help everyone. Yet, it keeps something so useful as a secret method of travel to itself. Your little secret has been exposed, and these crews will ensure it becomes available to everyone."
"Damnit, she gave us the slip. And she's left even more obstacles in our path. More ships are trying to force their way back into the network. As a result, the network is fighting back even harder."

responses.text: "How did Moll even get in? How are these others getting in?"
"What exactly is the network doing to fight back?"
"Wait, can I have a spore drive?"

screens.text: "I hate to think about what this could mean for the fabric of space. The network's attack on these ships has destroyed a few and yet they keep trying to enter. Idiots!"

"I'm still not sure about Moll. We have our suspicions though. As for the others, Moll seems to have created a hole by way of an anomaly once she was in. Then, of course, there's the hole we created to get rid of the intruders! I think both will close - we just need time!"
"I don't know how strong your stomach is, Captain, so I'd rather not describe what we found on the remains of one ship. All I'll say is that it's like an immune system waging war on harmful cells."
"Is this really the time for that? Help us to secure the network and maybe,  maybe, we'll talk."
"Captain, we need you to fight off the ships trying to enter the network until the openings close!"
